review: I have a SmartTV, AppleTV, Chromecast and Roku that can access Netflix, Hulu Plus and Amazon Prime but using the Fire TV Stick is much more fluid.Reasons why I use the Fire TV Stick:-Included Remote Control (batteries included): no line of sight needed-Very fast at accessing library-Low profile; basically a dongle on one HDMI port and USB port-Access to Amazon Prime Video-Light gaming (flappy bird; 'nuff said)Reasons why I don't use Chromecast:-No remote; your phone or PC/Mac essentially is your remote-No native appsReasons why I don't use Roku:-Roku is really great, but Amazon Fire TV stick is much faster and more fluidReasons why I don't use AppleTV:-Actually AppleTV is a great alternative if you bought into the Apple ecosystem-My AppleTV is tucked away on the TV stand and sometimes the remote doesn't register. I can move it, but my kids would touch it or move it back again...Reasons why I don't use the SMART TV:-Very clunky and slow-Wireless sometimes spottyEver since I bought the FireTV Stick, I haven't touched the other devices. Time to sell all because I found the device of choice... at least for now.

review: It seems to crash a lot, the interface also takes some getting used to, its a bit counterintuitive to me.It has a lot of apps (just like Google's Chromecast) but I haven't found Youtube, not sure if its not on there or what - if so, big disappointment.The screen mirroring function also ties up your tablet or phone so you can't do anything else, whereas with Chromecast I can throw my screen to the TV and still use my phone (slooooooow as it may be).
